climbs.name: Wasp
climbs.fa: Dan Dellinges, Larry Zulim, Bryan Lang, 2017-2018

content.description: Fun little warmup route. Guidebook calls it a 5.8 off-width, but those moves are optional. Far easier than a 5.7 off-width in Yosemite. Pro is great--many options--can place big gear or find other options for small gear; there's even a block you can sling. I didn't clip any of the bolts and felt they were not necessary.
content.protection: gear to 5" (however the 4-5" stuff might not be necessary)
content.location: wide crack just right of the "nose"

content.description: Strange bit of flake on the left side of the right formation. Pretty good warm up route
content.protection: one bolt, one #4 and a couple small pieces from .3-.5. 2 bolt anchor with sport clips
content.location: look for the spire looking flake with a bolt to the right of it. Second left most right between Bryan's song and Paul's crack

content.description: Climb up intermittent cracks to gain the left most roof crack. Great gear protects the wild moves to pull the roof. Perfects jams make this much easier than it looks from the ground.
content.location: Left most crack splitting the visor like roof

content.description: Some stiff moves slick laybacking up the initial flake/crack leads to easy moves above.
content.location: Far left of the crag. Starts up an arching flake

content.description: Climb up a long angle slab that is marked with a tiny finger crack. Clip a bolt and launch onto the slab. he crux comes at the end with a slab mantel move.
content.location: The first bolted route on the far right side of the crag

content.description: Great crack climb with a multiple width crack requiring fingers to solid hands. Protects really well, fun movement.
content.location: Next major crack system to the right if Wasp

content.description: Excellent jams up a flared corner system. Slick feet to the left make this route more challenging than it would appear from the ground. Excellent gear, protects very well. Quite fun!
content.location: Start up cracks leading to the obvious corner crack system to the left of the Scorpion roof.

climbs.name: Dream on
climbs.fa: Dan Dellinges, Larry Zulim, Bryan Lang, 2017-2018; FFA: Chris Manzanares, 2019

content.description: 5.10a A0 if you pull on first bolt, 5.11a free. After the first 1 or 2 slab moves on dime edges, climbing eases.
content.location: left of Hawk man and right of Bryan's song, goes up blank face for 2 bolts, into a corner, which eventually ends and more face climbing to anchor.

content.description: A tricky friction slab. Crux moves on friction come early, then easier face climbing above
content.protection: Bolts. Optional cam in the crack
content.location: Bolted line up the center of the slab.

content.description:
Grovel up the weird chimney thing, and then move onto the overhanging flake. A mixture of jams and lay backing will pull you through the crux. Good fun!

Watch that your rope doesn't get stuck in the roof crack when lowering....
content.location: This is one of two cracks which bisects the obvious visor like rook. Batman takes the wider crack to the right.
